name: Bristol Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was classy, well appointed, clean good size rooms, and very friendly and helpful staff. Location for us was great since we took the train to get to San Diego, just a few blocks from the railroad station, lots of public transportation, very close to the gaslamp district, good shopping, and downtown in general.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL HOTEL BUT A LITTLE NOISY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only problem was - the trolley started running before 6 am just a few feet from the hotel and the Grayhound terminal accross the street was also active early. Even though we were on the 4th floor, the noise was enough to wake me up and keep me up.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Will stay here again - you should too. Insist on a room facing away from street.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at The Bristol Hotel in the wee hours of the morning due to airline cancellations and delays and also had no luggage. The night concierge was very sympathetic and kindly provided us with toothbrushes and toothpaste. Our room was very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The day concierge recommended some restaurants in the vicinity and after walking around and exploring, we found that we were in an area surrounded by restaurants and shops. The hotel was within a very short walk to the Horton Plaza shopping mall and a short drive to Coronado Island. We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Bristol Hotel is a clean and comfortable hotel. it's very charming. The location is excellent. It's close to everything. The $26 per day parking was a little much but no complaints besides that.
reviews.title: Bristol felt like home during Comic-Con.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Stayed at Bristol hotel with my boyfriend on fourth of July weekend. The hotel was kind of pricey but well worth it! The staff are very helpfull and professional. The hotel comes with complimentary wifi in the room you stay in....it was a bit slow, but a nice convenience. The hotel has valet parking that costs about $26 per night but if you have a hybrid car it costs about half that. The room was cute and we could see the ocean from our window. The bed was very comfortable and there is an ipod docking station in the room as well as a flat screen tv and fridge. The hotel has a restaraunt and other numerous places to eat around the hotel as well as a grocery store (i think its a ralphs) down the street. The hotel is walking distance to the downtown area which we enjoyed very much. If you go downtown and like pubs i reccomend The Field for food and drink....try the boxties they are amazing! We drove to sea world which is really easy to get to from the hotel...it maybe took us 15 minutes to drive there. There are busses and trolleys right next to the hotel if you are interested in using that. after all the fees (like valet parking) the hotel came out to about $170/night. If that is too much for u i reccomend looking into staying into the little Italy area of san diego like the porto vista hotel or la pensione which will be anywhere from $100-$130/night.
reviews.title: Great hotel in awesome location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right on the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter, within walking distance to all restaurants and stores but without all the noise when you are trying to sleep. The rooms are clean, big and decorated nicely. Beds are very comfortable. Parking is expensive though.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our first trip to San Deigo and we were unsure of where to stay as we didn't want to rent a car and appreciate public transportation. We couldn't have picked a better location for all of our wants. Our goal is to find a clean and comfortable place to stay, and we found all of this at The Bristol. After reading the reviews I was comfortable with booking this hotel and after staying there, I would say this was a great find. We are used to walking and using public transportation and we had no problem getting around San Diego from our location. Our party consists of two moms and our daughters and we felt safe and comfortable at all times. You will not be disappointed staying at The Bristol.
reviews.title: Fantastic Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: LOVE IT! This place is hands down, absolutely fantastic! I wasn't sure what to expect, however it's SUPER clean, decorated beautifully, FANTASTIC staff. We will certainly stay here again when we go back. The staff was kind enough to let us check in about an hour & half early and what a view we had!!! We loved it! You will too!!! Note: there is a $26 nightly fee for parking we didn't know about, but again, it's worth it. It's only abt 5 blocks up from the fairy that you can take to Coronado island. However; for those looking to go to "the Del" realize that the fairy drops you off on the opposite side of the island. (we didn't realize that either) However we took the bus to The Del. Book at the Bristol....you won't regret it!!!!
reviews.title: What a GEM!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a 4 night stay at this hotel as part of a holiday to california and it was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were large and nicely decorated. The hotel has a modern feel with great friendly staff. The location is great. You can walk to the harbour, train station, and famous gaslamp district with lots of restaurants. The only downside to this is that the busy street noice can be heard in the rooms but not so much to be a bother. I can be quite critical of hotels and feel that city hotels sometimes are a let down, but not the Bristol. It is fantasic and would defo stay again and recommend to friends/family.
reviews.title: Great value. Would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. It was great value, beds comfy, water pressure great...good place to rest your head for the night. It's best feature is its location! Really close to public transit, which is really easy to use! Internet was free! Only thing missing is they would really benefit from having an onsight concierge who knows about the city. The people at the front desk were very friendly but could not give very good directions or suggestions to eat.
reviews.title: Fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Bristol for an entire week. The room was large and quite pleasantly decorated. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly in a non-anonymous way. The location turned out to be great, with pretty much everything reachable by foot. I was provided with breakfast vouchers for the entire stay, which could be used in the restaurant downstairs. The breakfast was fine, though I would have preferred a buffet, as opposed to the served breakfast, because it's much faster. Another minor critique is the speed of the (complimentary!) internet, which was a bit sub-par. Those set aside, this was a very good deal and I surely enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Good value for money in downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: stayed at the Bristol for 3 nights after a great deal from this site, close to everything - shops, Gaslamp area, everything. the room was fantastic -812- quiet and the bed super comfortable all the staff couldnt be more friendly or helpful when i arrived the guy at reception told me about the baseball game on that night and where to get cheap tickets. they even had the Aussie flag out the front ! the carpet and beadsperads are a little wild but i actually began to like them in the end! would recommend to anyone and would stay again.
reviews.title: would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Bristol Hotel for two nights in May. The best part of this hotel is definitely the service - we received excellent service from the valet, front desk personnel, maid, bellman and restaurant host (even though we weren't eating at the restaurant.) We stayed on the 4th floor (the dog friendly floor since we had our dog with us) and our room's window faced away from the street, so we didn't experience any of the street noise that some other reviewers complained about. The location of the hotel is right downtown, so you will have to deal with a cast of vagrants, transients, homeless people and drunks, but that's what you'd get at pretty much any mid to large city's downtown area.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly Hotel, Good Value, Decent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was clean, the amenities were nice, the mattress was a little softer than I normally like and the bathroom was too dark, but overall this hotel was worth the money. It's in walking distance of the Gaslamp area as well as most of the things you'd want to do downtown, so the location is great.
reviews.title: Well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Bristol 4/29 - 5/2. This hotel is amazing. It is a boutique hotel geared towards excellent customer service. From the valet parking to the front desk to housekeeping, everyone was amazing. The room given us on the first night was on the street side of the hotel. Unfortunately I am a light sleeper so we decided to ask to be moved to a quieter room the next morning. Not only did they move us, but they upgraded us to a huge deluxe king room. All this was done with a smile AND an apology (although this was not their fault at all).
reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is perfect. Just down the street is plenty of places to eat and listen to live music.
reviews.title: A Real Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wil definitely return to The Bristol when visiting San Diego.
reviews.title: Wonderful affordable getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I booked a room at The Bristol because I needed a centrally located hotel in San Diego, and its price ($77 a night) was so much cheaper than anywhere else downtown. I started having misgivings that with that price, the place might be a dump. I decided to give it a chance, as I had stayed there many years ago when it was called The Executive. I'm glad I did. The hotel has been refurbished. I had a nice room with very modern, upscale decor. The staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable, and the place was clean. I couldn't ask for more, and at that price, it was a steal. I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: excellent value for the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only live a couple of hours away from San Diego but when I found this deal for $79/nt at the Bristol Hotel we could not pass it up. It is a cute little boutique hotel in a prime location. Don't be deceived by the 70's architecture on the outside because it's much more modern inside. Our wknd was also started off right by the friendly staff & a free upgrade on our room. They also gave us an invaluable cost-saving tip....all loading zone/temporary parking around the hotel was free & unlimited after 6pm until 7am the next morning (sundays are free all day). Just make sure its not street cleaning day. Saved us $26/nt! The rooms were surprisingly spacious, clean & did not smell like pets (they allow pets in some of the rooms). The only downside was the shower/tub was very small except for a tiny person like myself. Two great bonuses: an ipod player & free wireless internet. Also, the hotel was in walking distance to the great nightlife on 4th/5th Ave. We've already recommended this hotel to friends & can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Night

description: The Bristol Hotel, a premier boutique hotel in downtown San Diego, offers extreme comfort and friendly service whether your travel is for business or leisure. The Bristol Hotel is a fresh take on modern style - our sophisticated atmosphere awaits you in our contemporary lobby and throughout our eclectically styled San Diego hotel rooms. This modern flair continues throughout the lounge and banquet facilities and is sure to be a perfect choice for business, leisure, group functions, meetings and special events. This downtown hotel’s superb location is within blocks of the Gaslamp Quarter, fine dining, world-class shopping at Horton Plaza, the Cruise Ship Terminal, the Convention Center, Petco Park, Theatre District, East Village, Little Italy, San Diego Concourse and the San Diego Bay. This pet-friendly San Diego hotel is only a short drive to any of the many sunny beaches, the San Diego Zoo, and SeaWorld. The Bristol Hotel is one of only seven hotels in San Diego to receive the Green Eco-Leaf Rating and is also a certified member of the California Green Lodging Program.
